title: Isle of Thanet Rural District

section_text: Isle of Thanet Rural DistrictArea • 191120,825 acres ( 84.28 km2 ) • 192118,639 acres ( 75.43 km2 ) • 193118,639 acres ( 75.43 km2 ) Population • 191111,144 • 192110,564 • 193114,085 History • Created1894 • Abolished1935 GovernmentIsle of Thanet Rural District Council • HQRural District Offices , Minster The Isle of Thanet Rural District was a rural district covering part of the Isle of Thanet in the county of Kent , England , from 1894 to 1935 . Most of its former area is now part of the Thanet district . When the district was created several ancient parishes were split to create urban and rural parts . Northdown was created from the part of Margate St John the Baptist that was outside the Municipal Borough of Margate , St Lawrence Extra was created from the part of St Lawrence that was outside the Municipal Borough of Ramsgate . St Peter Extra was created from the part of St Peter 's that was not part of Broadstairs and St Peter 's Urban District . It included the following civil parishes : [ 1 ]
intro: The Isle of Thanet Rural District was a rural district covering part of the Isle of Thanet in the county of Kent, England, from 1894 to 1935. Most of its former area is now part of the Thanet district. When the district was created several ancient parishes were split to create urban and rural parts. Northdown was created from the part of Margate St John the Baptist that was outside the Municipal Borough of Margate, St Lawrence Extra was created from the part of St Lawrence that was outside the Municipal Borough of Ramsgate. St Peter Extra was created from the part of St Peter's that was not part of Broadstairs and St Peter's Urban District. It included the following civil parishes:
